definitions.definition: To make something (such as an object or message ) go from one place to another (or to someone).
examples: Every day at two o'clock, he sends his secretary out to buy him a coffee.
She sends me a letter every month.
Some hooligan sent a brick flying through the window, and the bang sent us running out of the building.

definitions.definition: To get one going; move to excitement or rapture ; to delight or thrill .
examples: I don't know what it is, but this music really sends me.

definitions.definition: To bring to a certain condition , to drive.
To dispatch an agent or messenger to convey a message or do an errand .
examples: Seeing how ill she was, we sent for a doctor at once.

definitions.definition: To cause to be or to happen ; to bring ; bring about .

subdefinitions.label_groups: archaic , of a blessing or reward
archaic , of a curse or punishment

labels: sometimes followed by a dependent proposition
definitions.label_groups: transitive , sometimes followed by a dependent proposition

definitions.definition: To climb a route without falling.
examples: She finally sent the 12a after hours of failed attempts.

definitions.definition: To pursue (a course of action) committedly, enthusiastically, and often recklessly; go for .
To care . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
To call out or diss a specific person in a diss track .
To give (someone) a lift , to drive (someone) to another place.

main_definition: ( transitive , ditransitive ) To make something (such as an object or message ) go from one place to another (or to someone).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , slang ) To get one going; move to excitement or rapture ; to delight or thrill .
( transitive ) To bring to a certain condition , to drive.
( intransitive , usually with for ) To dispatch an agent or messenger to convey a message or do an errand .
( transitive , sometimes followed by a dependent proposition ) To cause to be or to happen ; to bring ; bring about .
( climbing , transitive ) To climb a route without falling.
( slang ) To pursue (a course of action) committedly, enthusiastically, and often recklessly; go for .
( Nigeria , slang , intransitive ) To care . (Can we add an example for this sense?)
( UK , slang ) To call out or diss a specific person in a diss track .
( Singapore , transitive ) To give (someone) a lift , to drive (someone) to another place.
